text: Peter Finley Secchia (April 15, 1937 â€“ October 21, 2020) was an American businessman and diplomat. He served as the U.S. ambassador to Italy and San Marino from 1989 to 1993. He was a Republican. Secchia was born in Englewood, New Jersey. He served in the United States Marine Corps from 1956 to 1959. Secchia died of COVID-19 on October 21, 2020, in Grand Rapids, Michigan. He was 83. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Michigan Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Italy Category:Businesspeople from New Jersey Category:People from Englewood, New Jersey Category:Businesspeople from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:Politicians from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:Politicians from New Jersey Category:United States Marine Corps personnel Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Peter F. Secchia
